4. Module Documentation¶

To be done...

4.1. Cost and Scaling Model Utilities¶

Cost escalators are used to adjust for input factor prices trends for materials and labor associated with turbine manufacturing, plant development and operation.

4.2. Turbine Capital Costs (TCC) Module¶

The NREL Cost and Scaling Model turbine module calculates turbine component costs and masses (either onshore or offshore). This excludes the foundation which is considered part of the balance of station even for offshore plants.

4.2.1. csmTurbine¶

This class calculates the the component masses and costs for a wind turbine using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmTurbine.csmTurbine¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for operations and maintenance costs.
compute([hubHeight, machineRating, ...]) Computes the turbine component masses and costs using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getMass() Provides the overall turbine mass.
getCost() Provides the turbine capital costs for a single turbine.

There are several sub-modules in the overall TCC module for each of the major sub-systems including the blades, hub, nacelle and tower.

4.2.2. csmBlades¶

This class calculates wind turbine blade mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmBlades.csmBlades¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for the wind turbine blade
compute([diam, advanced, curr_yr, curr_mon, ...]) Compute mass and cost for a single wind turbine blade by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(diam[, advanced]) Compute mass for a single wind turbine blade using NREL cost and scaling model
computeCost(diam[, advanced, curr_yr, curr_mon]) Compute cost for a single wind turbine blade using NREL cost and scaling model
getMass() Provides the mass for the wind turbine blade.
getCost() Provides the cost for the wind turbine blade.

Example

The following is an example use of the individual csmBlades module.

Output should be:

Conventional blade design: Blades 276129.6 K$ 25614.4 kg

Advanced blade design: Blades 251227.0 K$ 17650.7 kg

4.2.3. csmHub¶

This class calculates wind turbine hub system mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmHub.csmHub¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for csm Hub
compute(blademass[, diam, nblades, curr_yr, ...]) Compute mass and cost for the hub system by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(blademass[, diam, nblades]) Compute mass for the hub system based on NREL Cost and Scaling Model
computeCost([diam, curr_yr, curr_mon, ...]) Compute cost for the hub system by the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
getMass() Provides the overall hub system mass.
getCost() Provides the overall hub system cost.
getHubComponentMasses() Provides the detail on hub system component masses.
getHubComponentCosts() Provides the overall hub system cost.

Example

The following is an example use of the individual csmHub module.

The output should be:

Hub System Components:
Hub 124903.9 K$ 22519.7 kg Pitch Mech 24379.7 K$ 10313.9 kg Nose Cone 10509.0 K$ 1810.5 kg

Hub total 379152.6 K$ 34644.2 kg

4.2.4. csmNacelle¶

This class calculates wind turbine hub system mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmNacelle.csmNacelle¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for the nacelle
compute(RotorDiam, MachineRating, RotorMass, ...) Compute mass and cost for a full wind turbine Nacelle by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(RotorDiam, MachineRating, ...[, ...]) Compute mass for a full wind turbine Nacelle using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
computeCost(RotorDiam, MachineRating, ...[, ...]) Compute cost for a full wind turbine Nacelle using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
getMass() Provides the mass for the overall wind turbine nacelle assembly.
getCost() Provides the cost for the overall wind turbine nacelle assembly.
getNacelleComponentMasses() Provides the mass for the overall wind turbine nacelle components.
getNacelleComponentCosts() Provides the cost for the overall wind turbine nacelle components.

Example

The following is an example use of the individual csmNacelle module.

Output should be:

Nacelle Total 3249404.5229 K$ 223315.6984 kg

Within the nacelle, there are additional sub-modules for the low-speed shaft, the gearbox and the generator.

4.2.5. LowSpdShaft¶

This class calculates wind turbine low speed shaft mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmNacelle.LowSpdShaft¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for low speed shaft
compute(RotorDiam, RotorMass, RotorTorque, ...) Compute mass and cost for a low speed shaft by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(RotorDiam, RotorMass, RotorTorque) Compute mass for a low speed shaft using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
computeCost(RotorDiam, curr_yr, curr_mon) Compute cost for a low speed shaft using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
getMass() Provides the mass for the low speed shaft.
getCost() Provides the cost for the wind turbine low speed shaft.

4.2.6. GearBox¶

This class calculates wind turbine gearbox mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmNacelle.GearBox¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for gearbox
compute(iDsgn, MachineRating, RotorTorque, ...) Compute mass and cost for a gearbox by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(iDsgn, RotorTorque) Compute mass for a gearbox using the cost and scaling model
computeCost(iDsgn, MachineRating, curr_yr, ...) Compute cost for a gearbox using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
getMass() Provides the mass for the gearbox.
getCost() Provides the cost for the wind turbine gearbox.

4.2.7. Generator¶

This class calculates wind turbine generator mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmNacelle.Generator¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for the generator
compute(iDsgn, MachineRating, RotorTorque, ...) Compute mass and cost for a generator by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(iDsgn, MachineRating, RotorTorque) Compute mass for a generator using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
computeCost(iDsgn, MachineRating, curr_yr, ...) Compute mass and cost for a generator using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
getMass() Provides the mass for the generator.
getCost() Provides the cost for the wind turbine generator.

4.2.8. csmTower¶

This class calculates wind turbine tower mass and cost based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model.

class csm.src.csmTower.csmTower¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize the parameters for the wind turbine tower
compute(RotorDiam, HubHeight[, curr_yr, ...]) Compute mass and cost for a wind turbine tower by calling computeMass and computeCost
computeMass(RotorDiam, HubHeight) Compute mass for a wind turbine tower using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model
computeCost(curr_yr, curr_mon[, towerMass]) Compute cost for a wind turbine tower by calling computeMass and computeCost
getMass() Provides the mass for the wind turbine tower.
getCost() Provides the cost for the wind turbine tower.

Example

The following is an example use of the individual csmTower module.

Output should be:

Tower Mass: 444384.157764 Tower Cost: 1009500.23594

Examples The following is an example use of the overall csmTurbine module for calculating the onshore and offshore wind turbine costs using the NREL 5 MW reference turbine [1]_:

Output should be:

Onshore configuration 5 MW turbine: Turbine total: 5487334.85 $K 774049.19 kg

Offshore configuration 5 MW turbine: Turbine total: 6064385.11 $K 774049.19 kg

References

[1]Jonkman, J.; Butterfield, S.; Musial, W.; Scott, G. (2009). “Definition of a 5-MW Reference Wind Turbine for Offshore System Development.” NREL/TP-500-38060. Golden, CO: National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 75 pp.

4.3. Balance of Station Costs (BOS) Module¶

The NREL Cost and Scaling Model balance of station module calculates the installation, assembly and other non-turbine capital costs associated with the development of a wind plant (either onshore or offshore). The foundation is considered part of the balance of station even for offshore plants.

4.3.1. csmBOS¶

class csm.src.csmBOS.csmBOS¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for balance of plant costs including default inputs
compute(seaDepth, machineRating, hubHt, ...) Computes the balance of station costs for a wind plant using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getCost() Provides the overall balance of station costs for the plant.
getDetailedCosts() Provides the detailed balance of station costs for the plant.

4.3.2. csmFoundation¶

class csm.src.csmFoundation.csmFoundation¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for balance of plant foundation cost.
compute(MachineRating, HubHt, RotorDiam, ...) Computes the balance of station foundation costs for a wind plant using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getCost() Provides the overall balance of station costs for the plant.

Examples The following is an example use of csmBOS for calculating the onshore and offshore wind plant Balance of Station Costs using the NREL 5 MW reference turbine [1]_:

The output should appear as: BOS cost onshore: 3084560.970 BOS cost offshore: 7613488.697

The following is an example use of csmBOS for calculating the onshore and offshore wind plant Balance of Station Foundation Costs using the NREL 5 MW reference turbine [1]_:

Onshore foundation cost: Foundation cost: 120779.05392 Offshore foundation cost: Foundation cost: 2125550.66079

References

[1]Jonkman, J.; Butterfield, S.; Musial, W.; Scott, G. (2009). “Definition of a 5-MW Reference Wind Turbine for Offshore System Development.” NREL/TP-500-38060. Golden, CO: National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 75 pp.

4.4. Operations and Maintenance (O&M) Module¶

The NREL Cost and Scaling Model operations and maintenance module calculates the operations and maintenance, land lease costs, levelized replacement costs for operating a wind plant (either onshore or offshore).

4.4.1. csmOM¶

class csm.src.csmOM.csmOM¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for operations and maintenance costs.
compute(aep, seaDepth, machineRating, year, ...) Computes the operations and maintenance costs for a wind plant using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getOMCost() Provides the operations and maintenance costs for the plant.
getLLC() Provides the land lease costs costs for the plant.
getLRC() Provides the levelized replacement costs costs for the plant.

Examples The following is an example use of csmOM for calculating the onshore and offshore wind plant Operations and Maintenance Costs:

Output should be:

OM costs onshore 144053.487 LevRep 58699.223 Lease 22225.395

OM costs offshore 401819.023 LevRep 91048.387 Lease 22225.395

4.5. Annual Energy Production (AEP)¶

The annual energy production model uses methods as described in the references for determining a wind plant annual energy production from a small number of site and turbine design input parameters. Within the AEP module are sub-modules for determining the wind turbine power curve and drivetrain efficiency.

4.5.1. csmAEP¶

The NREL Cost and Scaling Model AEP calculation based on a Weibull distribution of wind speed and input assumptions regarding plant losses.

class csm.src.csmAEP.csmAEP¶

Methods

__init__()
compute(powercurve[, ratedPower, hubHt, ...]) Computes annual energy production from a wind plant
getAEP() Returns annual energy production for the project.
getCapacityFactor() Returns project capacity factor.

Example The following is an example use of csmAEP to calculate the annual energy production for a fictitious plant using the NREL 5 MW Reference Turbine [1]_:

The output should appear as: AEP: 18744306.322 MWh (for Rated Power: 5000.0) CapFactor: 42.795 %

References

[1]Jonkman, J.; Butterfield, S.; Musial, W.; Scott, G. (2009). “Definition of a 5-MW Reference Wind Turbine for Offshore System Development.” NREL/TP-500-38060. Golden, CO: National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 75 pp.

4.6. csmPowerCurve Module¶

This module determines a wind turbine power curve which accounts for drivetrain efficiency. It is based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model and requires a small number of input parameters as described below.

4.6.1. csmPowerCurve¶

The NREL Cost and Scaling Model Power Curve module.

class csm.src.csmPowerCurve.csmPowerCurve¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for power curve
compute(drivetrain[, hubHt, ratedPower, ...]) Computes the ideal power curve for a turbine after drivetrain losses using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getRatedWindSpeed() Provides the minimum wind speed required for a turbine to operate at rated power after drivetrain losses are deducted.
getRatedRotorSpeed() Provides the rotor speed for a tubrine operating at rated power after drivetrain losses are deducted.
getMaxEfficiency() Provides the maximum drivetrain efficiency for a power curve.
getPowerCurve() Gives an array of power output as a function of input wind speed for a wind turbine accounting for drivetrain losses.
idealPowerCurve(Wind, ITP, kTorque, ...) Determine the ITP (idealized turbine power) array

Example The following is an example use of csmPowerCurve to the a power curve based on the NREL 5 MW Reference Turbine [1]_:

The output should appear as: Rated Speed: 11.750 mps Rated RPM: 12.126 rpm

Along with the below plot.

References

[1]Jonkman, J.; Butterfield, S.; Musial, W.; Scott, G. (2009). “Definition of a 5-MW Reference Wind Turbine for Offshore System Development.” NREL/TP-500-38060. Golden, CO: National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 75 pp.

4.7. Drivetrain Efficiency Module¶

This module describes an interface for drivetrain efficiency analysis as well as a model based on the NREL Cost and Scaling Model which implements the interface. The methods are necessary to determine the actual output power of a wind turbine to the interconnection point after drivetrain losses for the drivetrain (gearbox, generator, etc) are taken into account. The simplified model is based on the analysis done in reference [1]_.

4.7.1. DrivetrainEfficiencyModel¶

class csm.src.csmDriveEfficiency.DrivetrainEfficiencyModel¶

Methods

getMaxEfficiency() Return maximum efficiency of the generator
getDrivetrainEfficiency(outputPower, ...) Returns efficiency of drivetrain operating at a ratio of outputPower to ratedHubPower

4.7.2. csmDrivetrainModel¶

class csm.src.csmDriveEfficiency.csmDriveEfficiency¶

Methods

__init__(drivetrainDesign) Set efficiency calculation coefficients based on drivetrain configuration type.
getMaxEfficiency() Uses quadratic formula to calculate maximum drivetrain efficiency with coefficients based on drivetrain configuration.
getDrivetrainEfficiency(outputPower, ...) Uses quadratic formula to calculate drivetrain efficiency with coefficients based on drivetrain configuraiton.

Example The following is an example use of csmDriveEfficiency to determine the maximum drivetrain efficiency for a wind turbine with a 3-staged gearbox and induction generator drivetrain configuration:

The output should appear as: Max Efficiency: 0.902 Output power: 3422.000 Rated power: 5543.000 Efficiency: 0.894

References

[1]Maples, B.; Hand, M.; Musial, W. (2010). “Comparative Assessment of Direct Drive High Temperature Superconducting Generators in Multi-Megawatt Class Wind Turbines.” NREL/TP-5000-49086. Golden, CO: National Renewable Energy Laboratory, 40 pp.

4.8. Finance¶

This module uses the NREL Cost and Scaling Model to determine a wind plant project?s cost of energy and levelized cost of energy. It takes as input all the aggregate costs and financial parameters for the project.

4.8.1. csmFinance¶

class csm.src.csmFinance.csmFinance¶

Methods

__init__() Initialize properties for csmFinance
compute(ratedpwr, tcc, om, llc, lrc, bos, ...) Computes a wind plant cost of energy and levelized cost of energy using the NREL Cost and Scaling Model method.
getCOE() Returns the wind plant cost of energy
getLCOE() Returns the wind plant levelized cost of energy

Example The following is an example use of csmDriveEfficiency to determine the maximum drivetrain efficiency for a wind turbine with a 3-staged gearbox and induction generator drivetrain configuration:

The output should appear as: Onshore: LCOE: 0.052776 COE: 0.065765

Offshore: LCOE: 0.102919 COE: 0.119694
